pr_title: [netatmo] Added day, week, and month measurements to the weather station and indoor, outdoor, and rain modules

timeline.message:
[netatmo] Added day, week, and month measurements to the weather station and indoor, outdoor, and rain modules

Signed-off-by: Rob Nielsen <rob.nielsen@yahoo.com>

timeline.bodyText: This import looks strange. Maybe a more standard Java type could be used ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

timeline.bodyText: This import looks strange. Maybe a more standard Java type could be used ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

timeline.bodyText: This import looks strange. Maybe a more standard Java type could be used ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

timeline.bodyText: Is there a good reason it is not implemented like in other classes (using addMeasurement) ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: This module only has a single measurement for both week and month. I could have implemented the same as the others, but it basically adds some unnecessary code where the measurement is added to a list then the list is checked to see if it contains items before calling getMeasurements.
replies.author: robnielsen

timeline.bodyText: This import looks strange. Maybe a more standard Java type could be used ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

timeline.bodyText: You did not add the methods channelLinked and channelUnlinked to this class ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

timeline.message:
Changes from lolodomo's review

Signed-off-by: Rob Nielsen <rob.nielsen@yahoo.com>

Additional changes from lolodomo's review

Signed-off-by: Rob Nielsen <rob.nielsen@yahoo.com>

timeline.bodyText: An IllegalArgumentException is more appropriate here.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure this is something to throw an exception over. Maybe you could just log it and then exit early.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: These are going to be errors that should only occur during development.
replies.author: robnielsen

timeline.bodyText: Is there any way to put these methods in one of the handler parent classes instead of defining a utility class? Or do all the classes that call this not share the same hierarchy?
timeline.author: cpmeister

+package org.openhab.binding.netatmo.internal.station;
+
+import java.util.List;
+import java.util.Map;
+import java.util.Set;
+
+import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.NonNullByDefault;
+import org.eclipse.jdt.annotation.Nullable;
+import org.openhab.binding.netatmo.internal.handler.NetatmoBridgeHandler;
+
+/**
+ * This class holds various methods common to stations
+ *
+ * @author Rob Nielsen - Initial contribution
+ */
+@NonNullByDefault
+public class StationUtils {
+
+    public static void getMeasurements(NetatmoBridgeHandler handler, String device, @Nullable String module,

replies.bodyText: Yes, that is a good remark.
replies.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: The modules are grandchildren of AbstractNetatmoThingHandler, I moved it there.  It does appear that thermostat could take advantage of these methods as well.
replies.author: robnielsen

timeline.message:
Few more changes

Signed-off-by: Rob Nielsen <rob.nielsen@yahoo.com>

timeline.bodyText: Is it still required now that you declared this method in AbstractNetatmoThingHandler ?
timeline.author: lolodomo

replies.bodyText: Yes, its needed in NAMainHandler to tell it's modules to update.  It could be moved back to NetatmoModuleHandler, but shouldn't hurt to be here.
replies.author: robnielsen

timeline.bodyText: Are you sure this is called on handler startup? If it isn't then channelIds will never get populated if channels are already linked when the handler get initialized.
timeline.author: cpmeister

+    @Override

timeline.bodyText: Can't you just check if a channel is linked or not by calling isLinked(...)? Then you don't need to track all of the linked channel ids.
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: Ah, nvm, I see you still need it for the method above. In that case is there a way for you to abstract the linked channel id tracking logic into this class so that all the subclasses don't have to implement it?
replies.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: No, the channels that you can get measurements are unique by device and module.
replies.author: robnielsen

timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.message:
Use isLinked() as suggested by cpmeister.

Signed-off-by: Rob Nielsen <rob.nielsen@yahoo.com>

timeline.bodyText: This is already included in the parent class so you can remove this.
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.message:
removed unneeded updateMeasurements()

Signed-off-by: Rob Nielsen <rob.nielsen@yahoo.com>

timeline.bodyText: You can remove this as well, there are no other modifications to this file
timeline.author: cpmeister
